Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a voluted nozzle, decorated on the discus with the nymph Amaltheia with the goat Amaltheia, and the infant Zeus. Within the low base-ring is the impressed name FAVSTI. Buff clay covered with a worn orange to dark brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1892)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
